page.title: 09EAST KILBRIDE-ROADS
page.content: EAST KILBRIDE_ROADS In planning the new town of East Kilbride, access roads and major roads were carefully planned.For the pedestrian,there are roads leading to underpasses for safe walking to town centre or neighbourhood shops. Major roads link the main sections of the town and provide through routes to 10 motorways in all directions.Road 11 junctions are large roundabouts where pedestrians and cyclists use under passes for safety.Major roads provide direct routes to Glasgow taking 20 minutes by car or 40 minutes by regular bus services.Edinburgh,about an hour's car ride, is reached by the M8. motorway.Glasgow airport is 40 minutes on the A77.The M74 takes one South to England.
